content.rendered:
It’s natural to feel nervous about moving to a new city. Living in LA can be a lot of fun thanks to its vibrant culture. It’s a land of opportunities for students, young professionals and families! LA has a little something for everyone. But the downside is that LA can be expensive to live in, which can put a halt in your plans if you’re on a tight budget. Finding affordable neighborhoods in LA can be difficult especially if you’ve never been to the city before. But, we’re here to make the search a little easier. Read on to learn about some of the safest and cheapest places to live in Los Angeles.

Related: Pros and Cons Of Living in Los Angeles

Six Most Affordable Neighborhoods in LA

Like we said, we’re here to help with your hunt for affordable neighborhoods in LA. The mark of an affordable neighborhood are apartments that are cheaper to rent, as that’s going to be one of your biggest expenses.

Lakeview Terrace

According to AreaVibes, Lakeview Terrace has a crime rate that’s 19% lower than the national average, making it pretty safe to live in. If you’re thinking about living in LA, you’ll be glad to hear this neighborhood is also safer than 65% of other cities.

The average rent here is $1,479 easily making it one of the most affordable neighborhoods in LA.

La Puente

La Puente is a beautiful community that has a history dating back to 1841. This city is full of life and is one of the cheapest places to live in Los Angeles with an average monthly rent of only $1,444. However, with the layout of the neighborhood, this suburb is a better fit for individuals living alone as opposed to families.

Related: Living Cost In Los Angeles For Students: The Complete Guide

Lancaster

Lancaster is a pretty suburb located away from the main city. Peaceful and calm, this area is great for those who want access to the big city but also enjoy time off in a quieter place. The average rent for a one-bedroom apartment here is about $1,464. You can find excellent private and public schools in this neighborhood, making it a great fit for families moving with children.

Cudahy

If you’re looking for the cheapest neighborhood in LA, look no further! With the average rent of a one-bedroom apartment at only $914, you can find a place here to fit even the lowest budget. It is also the second smallest city in the country and is ideal if you enjoy living in smaller communities.

Related: 12 Best Things to Do in Downtown Los Angeles

Carson

One of the biggest advantages of living in Carson is its proximity to the LA airport. If you’re someone who travels a lot for work or pleasure, you might find this to be a convenient little spot. With a well-connected public transport system and the average rent at about $2,335 you’ll be living in one of the most affordable neighborhoods in LA.

Palmdale

Like Lancaster, Palmdale is a small, self-sufficient city on the outskirts of LA. It is relatively safe for individuals from all walks of life. With average rent at just over $1,519, Palmdale also falls into the category of the cheapest places to live in Los Angeles. According to reviews on Niche, Palmdale is similar to LA in terms of all of the amenities and facilities you can find. All of the advantages of LA but a lot cheaper? It’s definitely a win!

Related: Find Rooms For Rent in Central LA, Los Angeles

Find your next city with Roomi!

With this list of affordable neighborhoods in LA, you should be feeling more confident in moving to the city. Your next move will probably be to look for a place to stay. Depending on your budget, you may be looking to share a room or even get your own place while living in LA. You’d be surprised at how easy renting in LA can be if you sign up with Roomi  – a platform that will not only help you find rooms, but will also use a roommate matching algorithm to find you your perfect fit.

Roomi is your one-stop option to list or find rooms, find roommates to settle into a new city easily. Download the app and sign up today!

DOWNLOAD THE APP NOW!
